reviewText: Though performed and released in 2010, Bill Maher once again makes plenty of good points in But I'm Not Wrong (accurate title too- he's *not* wrong, hardly ever!)  I had a feeling going into this comedy routine that Bill's views on religion are, let's just say, less friendly compared to other views, haha.  He pretty much confirmed where he stands on religious matters on an episode of Jay Leno about a year ago.  He basically describes God and Jesus as fictional characters that people have been making up for over 2,000 years.  Do I agree with this?  Hmmm, haha.  Not really.  Mildly funny regardless though *incredibly* offensive to a person who's deeply religious (and understandably so).The political side of the routine is sort of dated now.  Sarah Palin, John McCain, the inauguration of Barack Obama, George Bush, Hillary and Bill Clinton... these people are quite the topic of Bill's conversation since they were relevant and newsworthy in 2010.My feelings overall on Bill Maher after watching this comedy special is that he makes several good points, is very offensive, nearly impossible to disagree with (except concerning the subject of religion of course which has always been debatable) and probably won't become religious any time soon... and neither will I.  However he's only funny about half the time.  Making good points and being funny aren't always one and the same, but humor is a matter of preference anyway.  Recommended for the strong material, but be prepared for several sexual-related content that borders on really strong.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I never had had a chance to see this stand-up routine from 2010.  Very interesting for a look back at the period.  Bill Maher is a good political comedian and even if I don't agree with him all the time I appreciate his intellect.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: "Champion of the Obvious!"  While I believe wholeheartedly in what Bill Maher has to say generally, he doesn't need to over use vulgarity to 'sell' his point of view.  Although the content of this DVD was right on, the delivery was terrible.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: Like most of his works,good to watch and listen to. Wish there was more of his stuff out there. THEY NEED TO PUT THIS ON CD'S
summary: A must for big fans of Bill Maher
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I actually stumbled on this at the library by accident, after watching Religulous and enjoying it I decided to give this a shot.What I found was something very similar to Robin Williams, Live on Broadway(which I also enjoyed)Topics such as Religion, Government, Politions, the Recession, the 2012 Election, as well as cheating scandles are covered in a humorous way.While it may not be a laugh a min. it is definitly funny with some great material by Bill Maher.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: "But I'm Not Wrong" was filmed in Raleigh, North Carolina on February 13, 2010; and broadcast live on HBO. The auditorium appears to be full, sold out. This is the full hour and a half of his one man stand up show.Maher's rant is beginning to show its age. His routine hasn't changed much in the last few years. Although the names are different, the jokes are pretty much the same. This show natters on for too long. Maher takes a good twenty minutes to warm up. He hits his stride at about one hour. The best jokes, most cutting commentary comes in the last twenty minutes.My complaint with this program is not Maher's politics, but the jokes just aren't as funny anymore. The surprise three minute encore, the Muslim Dior fashion show, over played it's hand, spent entirely too long on each model, and never really had a punch line (Maher reads from little blue cards). The jokes throughout the show were like this, set up for a fairly long time, telegraphed where they were going, delivered the punch line, and then reinforced the punch line for too many beats. This is a great method for teaching something, but not necessarily a method for comedians.It seemed to me that the audience wasn't laughing wildly at his jokes. Political and religious comedy has become a difficult domain. Maher pokes Republicans very squarely in the eye; there is a sense that he delivers equal time to the Fox News Network. But he does take that poking to an extreme. I think it is wonderful that we have somebody willing to defend a Democratic position, or at least common sense. I just wish he was funnier.Where Dennis Miller is way too cerebral and requires extreme current affairs knowledge to get his jokes; Maher is pretty easy to digest and does help the audience along explaining his jokes, he pushes the intellectual envelope for his audience. Maher shines in Politically Incorrect when he interviews his guests. Lively debate is something he does well. I have never been a huge fan of his monologue or stand up bits. This was a DVD of nothing but one long monologue.This is rated TV-MA, yes there is a lot of strong language in this performance. The performance flows aimlessly through mostly adult subjects, self pleasuring, defecating, marital relations, oral pleasure, and homosexual pleasures. The DVD is probably best suited for mature audiences.I used to really love Bill Maher. I found Religulous thought provoking and interesting to watch. This performance, I will likely forget soon. In a year or even six months, most of the jokes will be even less humorous. Sadly, Bill hasn't aged very well.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I like Bill Maher sometimes, but his standup act is surprisingly not very funny.  If you want good leftist humor, check out Lewis Black.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I love Bill Maher.  One of his best.  If you like this you will like his one on religion.  A must for a great laugh.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I saw this pathetic perfomance on TV. So, it was not necessary to flush my money down the toilet. Thanks, HBO! An interesting fact: this limousine liberal crudely mocked all major religions, except one. Any guesses?

reviewText: Always funny and always right on. But you need to be a liberal to enjoy this style of humor.
summary: Funny but be prepared to be open minded
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: Bill Maher has a talent for mixing his comedy routine with political viewpoints. The best part about his content is the fact that he is simply referencing contradictions and hypocrisy derived from hard facts. I enjoy watching his routines.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I was at this show, and loved it. Obviously, I am a fan, or I would not have bought tickets.Interesting thing about the show - it happened on Feb 13, the day after a massive snow storm moved over the entire state. But the show was sold out.I know some complained about Maher not being as funny as he once was. And though this may be somewhat true, I have to say that I didn't go because I was expecting a laugh a minute evening. Maher isn't exactly a comic anymore. He is a commentator who uses satire to make his points. And I tend to agree with many of them. This wasn't the blue collar comedy tour, this wasn't Robin Williams. This was Bill Maher, doing an extended version of what he does on his HBO show. And that's what I like.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: If you like Bill Maher, this DVD is for you. If you don't like Bill Maher but enjoy talking back to a DVD or enjoy being agitated by his views so you can blow off steam to your friends about what he says, this DVD is for you. If you can't stand Bill Maher you might want to buy this DVD anyway just to reinforce your negative attitude towards this clever, irreverant comedian who picks up where George Carlin left off.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I'm a fan of Bill Maher and I enjoyed every second of it, in "But I'm not wrong" he talks, laughs and points the finger at his favorite subjects:  religion, republicans and idiocy you won't be dissapointed
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I intentionally choose NOT to remain perpetually silent while Bill Maher continues to verbally shower my Creator with golden disrespect! No matter how one defines religion (including Bill Maher), religion is religion and God is God. The two are not the same. The way I see it, there are the many evolving religions of our world with their varying degrees of being God-Revealing (leading spiritually-minded truth-seeking soul-blossoming men and women to God). Then there are other so-called religions that have nothing to do with God (except that they use His Name, without permission, of course, to exert their powerfully manipulative control over others in a number of reprehensible ways not to exclude the rapid accumulation of material wealth achieved by gluttonously sucking the financial marrow from the monetary bones of their unsuspecting sheep, I mean...um, congregation). And then there is the personal religion of each faith-born child of God that is unique to each and every individual believer. That is primarily the one I am a big fan of. For the record (and because it is mainly how Mr. Maher mocked The Father and The Son in this show that triggered a critical response from me as expressed in this review), I make no claims about fully understanding The Paradise Trinity (but if my calculations are correct, I will have approximately all of eternity to ponder this intriguing mystery that for now I unequivocally accept by faith). I like the analogy of a tree with three branches more than others I've heard. One Tree. Three Branches. Tree = Trinity (Totality Quantity = 1). Three Branches = Father + Son + Spirit (Individuality Quantity = 3). So, getting back to my response to watching this DVD: It is because I do believe so passionately in the existential existence and primacy of The Paradise Trinity that I must speak out against the Trinity-targeting verbal atrocities I witnessed while watching something that I had, in error, determined was supposed to make me laugh.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: Bill Maher, is just a political hack who thinks he has to curse and go over the top with vulgarity to be heard.  While I do not agree with most of what Maher says or thinks, I used to respect him when he did his Politically Incorrect show, but anymore, he is just a lame liberal, clutching at a lost and hopeless career.  I consider renting this movie a cheap lesson, and will no longer listen or watch Bill Maher anymore.
summary: Not Funny, just vulgar and disgusting
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: Bill Maher is a funny guy. And a very smart guy. "... But I'm Not Wrong" delivers Maher's usual mix of politics, religion and observations about life. He's probably the sharpest political observer since George Carlin, but without Carlin's later bitterness. (Note: Rabid conservatives will not find him funny.)
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: He's one of the most intelligent and no-holds-barred comedic commentators of our time.  He's irreverent almost to a fault. If you're at all insulted by an in-your-face review of life as he sees it, Bill Maher will make you gasp.  To his credit, he's usually cuttingly on target and his wit and facial "verbiage" must be heard AND seen to be appreciated. He pushes his comedy to the limit and spares no one. I loved this DVD.  My only reason for giving it four rather than five stars was that he seemed a little forced at times and not as comfortable with his delivery as I expected. Perhaps that's because most of my exposure to Maher has been on his TV shows, where he interacts with other notables and plays off either their intelligence and wit or their stupidity. If you enjoy a great verbal punch, watch this guy put on his discerning mental gloves and start throwing jabs.
summary: You can't go wrong with Bill Maher.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: First of all the guy has never been funny. He has made some B movies that were silly and inane. His skewed outlook on humanity could only survive on an HBO show that nobody watches. Don't waste the time or any money on this one.
summary: In a world all his own.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: This sad excuse for a comedian deserves to be panned because he's a real lamebrain strutting around insulting and degrading people and forces that are way above him. He's a dirtbag who should repent. We've all made mistakes so when he apologizes for all the garbage he's talked he can join the rest of us as a decent human being.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: After watching a couple of Bill Maher comedy movies that were none too thrilling, I was beginning to wonder if he's just funny on "Real Time With Bill Maher." Sometimes I like his stand-up and sometimes I don't, but this one was HILARIOUS. I cried laughing at the bathroom stall leg stretch. There's about a 1% chance of me laughing at bodily humor jokes, but his analysis about why he doesn't open his legs that wide made tears come down my face. Outside of the crazy faces he makes, I wouldn't call Bill Maher a physical comedian. He's usually not as animated as comedian Martin Lawrence or actresses like Erika Alexander, but he did a lot of physical comedy in this film. The Michael Jackson Moonwalk and Ludacris "Area Codes" dance skit that he made into a semi-country style song made me fall out laughing again. He changed the entire beat of the song and made it sound way too happy go lucky. Just about every joke in here was a winner, minus the Muslim fashion show. He always comes down way too hard on an entire group of people because of a small percentage. Other than that, this one was a winner. This one will be on constant rotation.
summary: Now THIS is the comedian I like
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: If you had to buy one Bill Maher stand-up performance, this would be it.Most of the subjects he talks about on this one are social issues pertinent for a long time to come.Don't worry about it being too dated as time goes by.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: this dude is a clown and not a very funny one at that.  same old boring rants - he's just a bitter old turd.  I can't spend another minute looking at this ratfaced, whoremongering, god hating, vulgar, drug addict who in reality is a complete fool and doesn't even realize it.  but then I suppose that's what makes him such a fool.  he should retitle this "I Guess I'm Wrong About Pretty Much Everything and I'm Really Boring Too."

Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I saw this show when it aired on HBO and really enjoyed it.  Maher had noticeably stepped it up a few notches compared to his must-see weekly show Realtime, and I didn't think it could get any better... then I saw him live last month in person for the first time.  Spending two solid hours with a room full of refreshingly sane people with a great sense of humor was absolutely priceless.  I've never laughed so hard and often or clapped as vigorously, and I was one of the better behaved people in the audience.  I wouldn't exactly take medical advice from Bill, but he's got just about everything else figured out.  If you ever get the chance, see his act in person.  If you haven't seen Religulous yet, do so, because it's quite a treat for those of us who have learned to think for ourselves.  Bill Maher's invaluable contribution to modern American secularism simply cannot be overstated.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong

reviewText: I don't know why Bill Maher is considered funny. I literally did not even smile as I struggled through the first 20 minutes of this before giving up.Maybe if I shared his politics I would be more inclined to laugh, but Maher is really a political hack. He goes after Republicans, and that is fair enough, but he leaves equally dim Democrats alone. Does anyone really think that Debbie Wasserman-Schultz is smarter than Sarah Palin? So why isn't DWS fair game? And politicians like Shirley Jackson Lee or Hank Johnson, not too mention Joe Biden?If Maher really spoke truth to power, then I would be on board with his comedy, but he doesn't. He's just another political hack.
Title: Bill Maher: But I'm Not Wrong
